name: Pomme d'Or Hotel

reviews.text: The location of this hotel is excellent, we arrived at the airport and immediately got on the bus to the hotel - it couldn't be easier. The bus station is just around the corner from the hotel and within 2 minutes of getting of the bus we were checking in. Very good staff, pleasant and helpful. Our room was on the 3rd floor facing the street, not much of a view but if I had wanted a view I would have paid for it. The rooms were excellent, very clean and comfortable. Windows are double glazed as there was a little bit of noise in the evening but nothing terrible Good supply of tea,coffee etc. Toiletries were provided but there was no body cream, or hair condition. Breakfast was very good, lots of choice and plenty of it. The hotel is probably in one of the best positions for location, walking distance of the shops/bars etc. Liberation Square is the central point for coach trips etc. We decided to have dinner in the hotel on our second night, unfortunately this was a bit of a let down, the buffet starter was excellent - lots of choice and it was delicious, but there were just not enough staff to serve the main course, a couple of times the Chef had to leave the kitchen to get the waiters to serve the food. I also had to complain because my meal was stone cold, also a fellow traveller has a fish allergy and had to return her plate 3 times because they served it with fish - not so good. I would recommend this hotel, and would stay there again but would not have an evening meal there.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.text: My husband and I were taken to Jersey by friends as a treat for my 65th birthday. There were 5 of us in the party so we had three rooms booked. From the time we arrived until the time we checked out we were looked after superbly by the friendly but courteous staff, nothing was too much trouble for them. The hotel is not new but we could not fault our rooms which were clean and very comfortable with additions such as an iron etc.. The breakfasts were superb and very good value and we had dinner on one of our nights stay and that also was superb. We travel a lot both in the Uk and abroad and this hotel matches most hotels and given the price of the rooms is wonderful value. We would certainly recommend it and plan to go back for another stay. Also just to say its situation is central and convenient for shops and resturants.
reviews.title: An unexpected delight

reviews.text: This Hotel came reccommended highly from our Jersey friends, booked direct a standard room for two nights. Having never been to Jersey before, it really was very easy to get from the airport to St Helier, one way on the bus for £1.70 per adult ~ and it drops you right across from the Hotel in Independence Square.

reviews.text: We took the seafront trolly train to St Aubin and walked back ~ great views and took in the sea air. I hope we will return to Jersey soon and base at the Pomme D'Or again. After that walk we enjoyed the regular friday night seafood buffet in the Hotel restaurant. You may think that £26.50 per person is expensive but when you experience the range of fresh seafood and the volume one can eat - its well worth a try.

description: Superbly located in the centre of St. Helier, overlooking Liberation Square and the yacht marina, the Pomme d'Or has been a centre for business and pleasure for more than 175 years. Today the hotel combines its strong tradition of guest hospitality and care with a contemporary, metropolitan design which is perfect for both the leisure and business traveller.
